channel.title: Rolling Stone: Music News
channel.description: RollingStone.com the online version of Rolling Stone Magazine: music news, entertainment news, videos, photos, downloads, music reviews, movie reviews, music flashbacks, cover stories and online exclusives.

item.title: Chili Peppers, Cam'ron Top the Chart
item.description: Funk rockers dominate for second consecutive week, Harlem rapper does good
item.content:encoded:
Chili Peppers, Cam'ron Top the Chart
The wave can't stop for the Red Hot Chili Peppers. The funk rockers' double album, Stadium Arcadium, continued to rule the chart in its second week out, selling 157,000 more CDs, according to Nielsen SoundScan. And thanks to some nice positioning on...

item.title: Latest News: Keith Richards, Arctic Monkeys, Kaiser Chiefs and More
item.content:encoded:
Latest News: Keith Richards, Arctic Monkeys, Kaiser Chiefs and More
Richards Recovering in Connecticut

ROLLING STONES guitarist KEITH RICHARDS has returned to his Weston, Connecticut, estate to rest, following three weeks of treatment in New Zealand for the head injury he sustained after a fall from a palm tree in Fiji. "He is feeling...

item.title: The Walkmen Drive "A Hundred Miles"
item.description: Traveling band avoids writer's block by channeling Dylan, mariachis
item.content:encoded:
The Walkmen Drive "A Hundred Miles"
ONLINE EXCLUSIVE

The gas gauge was not the most precise piece of machinery, but when it was dipping below the big orange "E," it was time to filler up. John downshifted and brought the car to 45 mph before breaking to a gentle 20 mph -- then at...

item.title: The Band's Levon Helm Has His Day in Woodstock
item.description: Legendary rocker honored with key, day in his town
item.content:encoded:
The Band's Levon Helm Has His Day in Woodstock
ONLINE EXCLUSIVE

See the photo gallery

The town of Woodstock, New York, honored iconic drummer Levon Helm by officially declaring Saturday May 20th, 2006, Levon Helm Day....

item.title: Up in It
item.description: James Hetfield is feted by Tom Waits, Taking Back Sunday design their dream fest
item.content:encoded:
Up in It
MusiCares paid homage to Metallica's James Hetfield and manager-promoter Bill Silva for their sobriety recently during a very special night in L.A. The evening featured Velvet Revolver's acoustic version of Pink Floyd's "Wish You Were Here," as well as performances by Jason Mraz,...

item.title: Latest News: M.I.A., Axl, J. Lo and More
item.content:encoded:
Latest News: M.I.A., Axl, J. Lo and More
M.I.A. Denied U.S. Entrance

British by way of Sri Lanka, MC M.I.A. has reportedly been denied access into the United States by immigration officials. In response, the singer posted the following on a MySpace blog entitled "They Try Shut My Door": "Roger roger do you here me over!!!! The U.S immigration won't let me in!!!! . . . I'm locked out . . . Now I'm strictly making my...
